Hg server install

tweet! subscribe!

–û–ø—è—Ç—å —É–¥–∞—Ä–∏–ª–∞ –ø—É–ª—è –≤ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤—É –∏ –∑–∞—Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–∞ –¥–æ–º–∞—à–Ω–µ–º —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–µ –¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—Ç—å Mercurial —Ä–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –±—ã–ª –±—ã –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–µ–Ω –ø–æ http. –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞–º –ø–æ–Ω–∞–¥–æ–±–∏—Ç—Å—è Mercurial, Python, Apache2, –≤—Å–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ Ubuntu, –Ω–æ –∏ –¥–ª—è –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö OS –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Ç–æ—Ç –∂–µ.

sudo su -

apt-get install mercurial apache2 libapache2-mod-python

a2enmod python

/etc/init.d/apache2 reload

mkdir /home/hg

chown www-data:www-data /home/hg

cd /home/hg

–ü–æ—Ç–æ–º —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–µ–º —Ñ–∞–π–ª modpython_gateway.py —Å —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º:

import traceback

from mod_python import apache


class InputWrapper(object):


def init(self, req):

self.req = req


def close(self):

pass


def read(self, size=-1):

return self.req.read(size)


def readline(self, size=-1):

return self.req.readline(size)


def readlines(self, hint=-1):

return self.req.readlines(hint)


def iter(self):

line = self.readline()

while line:

yield line


    
	
  1. Notice this won’t prefetch the next line; it only
    2. 
	
  2. gets called if the generator is resumed.
    
line = self.readline()
    3. 



class ErrorWrapper(object):


def init(self, req):

self.req = req


def flush(self):

pass


def write(self, msg):

self.req.log_error(msg)


def writelines(self, seq):

self.write(’’.join(seq))


bad_value = ("You must provide a PythonOption ‘%s’, either ‘on’ or ‘off’, "

"when running a version of mod_python < 3.1")


class Handler:


def init(self, req):

self.started = False


options = req.get_options()


    
	
  1. Threading and forking
    
try:
    
q = apache.mpm_query
    
threaded = q(apache.AP_MPMQ_IS_THREADED)
    
forked = q(apache.AP_MPMQ_IS_FORKED)
    
except AttributeError:
    
threaded = options.get(‘multithread’, ‘’).lower()
    
if threaded == ’on’:
    
threaded = True
    
elif threaded == ‘off’:
    
threaded = False
    
else:
    
raise ValueError(bad_value % "multithread")
    2. 



forked = options.get(‘multiprocess’, ‘’).lower()

if forked == ’on’:

forked = True

elif forked == ‘off’:

forked = False

else:

raise ValueError(bad_value % "multiprocess")


env = self.environ = dict(apache.build_cgi_env(req))


if ‘SCRIPT_NAME’ in options:


    
	
  1. Override SCRIPT_NAME and PATH_INFO if requested.
    
env[‘SCRIPT_NAME’] = options[‘SCRIPT_NAME’]
    
env[‘PATH_INFO’] = req.uri[len(options[‘SCRIPT_NAME’]):]
    2. 



env[‘wsgi.input’] = InputWrapper(req)

env[‘wsgi.errors’] = ErrorWrapper(req)

env[‘wsgi.version’] = (1,0)

env[‘wsgi.run_once’] = False

if env.get("HTTPS") in (‘yes’, ‘on’, ‘1’):

env[‘wsgi.url_scheme’] = ‘https’

else:

env[‘wsgi.url_scheme’] = ‘http’

env[‘wsgi.multithread’]  = threaded

env[‘wsgi.multiprocess’] = forked


self.request = req


def run(self, application):

try:

result = application(self.environ, self.start_response)

for data in result:

self.write(data)

if not self.started:

self.request.set_content_length(0)

if hasattr(result, ‘close’):

result.close()

except:

traceback.print_exc(None, self.environ[‘wsgi.errors’])

if not self.started:

self.request.status = 500

self.request.content_type = ‘text/plain’

data = "A server error occurred. Please contact the administrator."

self.request.set_content_length(len(data))

self.request.write(data)


def start_response(self, status, headers, exc_info=None):

if exc_info:

try:

if self.started:

raise exc_info0, exc_info1, exc_info2

finally:

exc_info = None


self.request.status = int(status[:3])


for key, val in headers:

if key.lower() == ‘content-length’:

self.request.set_content_length(int(val))

elif key.lower() == ‘content-type’:

self.request.content_type = val

else:

self.request.headers_out.add(key, val)


return self.write


def write(self, data):

if not self.started:

self.started = True

self.request.write(data)


startup = None

cleanup = None


def handler(req):


    
	
  1. Run a startup function if requested.
    
global startup
    
if not startup:
    
func = req.get_options().get(‘wsgi.startup’)
    
if func:
    
module_name, object_str = func.split(‘::’, 1)
    
module = import(module_name, globals(), locals(), [’’])
    
startup = apache.resolve_object(module, object_str)
    
startup(req)
    2. 



    
	
  1. Register a cleanup function if requested.
    
global cleanup
    
if not cleanup:
    
func = req.get_options().get(‘wsgi.cleanup’)
    
if func:
    
module_name, object_str = func.split(‘::’, 1)
    
module = import(module_name, globals(), locals(), [’’])
    
cleanup = apache.resolve_object(module, object_str)
    
def cleaner(data):
    
cleanup()
    
try:
    2. 
	
  2. apache.register_cleanup wasn’t available until 3.1.4.
    
apache.register_cleanup(cleaner)
    
except AttributeError:
    
req.server.register_cleanup(req, cleaner)
    3. 



    
	
  1. Import the wsgi ‘application’ callable and pass it to Handler.run
    
modname, objname = req.get_options()[‘wsgi.application’].split(‘::’, 1)
    
module = import(modname, globals(), locals(), [’’])
    
app = getattr(module, objname)
    
Handler(req).run(app)
    2. 



    
	
  1. status was set in Handler; always return apache.OK
    
return apache.OK

–∏–ª–∏ —Å–∫–∞—á–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç—Å—é–¥–∞. –ó–∞—Ç–µ–º —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–µ–º —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–π —Ä–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–π:

cd /home/hg

mkdir hgtest; cd hgtest

hg init

echo ‘Hello World!’ >> README.txt

hg add README.txt

hg commit -m ‘this is the first change to my test repository’

–ó–∞—Ç–µ–º —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–µ–º —Ñ–∞–π–ª hgwebdir.py —Å —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º:

#!/usr/bin/env python

#


    
	
  1. $Id: hgwebdir.py 1478 2008-11-21 11:09:22Z matthew $
    
#
    2. 
	
  2. An example CGI script to export multiple hgweb repos, edit as necessary
    3. 



    
	
  1. adjust python path if not a system-wide install:
    
#import sys
    
#sys.path.insert(0, "/path/to/python/lib")
    2. 



    
	
  1. Uncomment to send python tracebacks to the browser if an error occurs:
    
import cgitb
    
cgitb.enable()
    2. 



    
	
  1. enable importing on demand to reduce startup time
    2. 
	
  2. from mercurial import demandimport; demandimport.enable()
    3. 
	
  3. from mercurial import demandload; demandload.enable()
    4. 



    
	
  1. If you’d like to serve pages with UTF-8 instead of your default
    2. 
	
  2. locale charset, you can do so by uncommenting the following lines.
    3. 
	
  3. Note that this will cause your .hgrc files to be interpreted in
    4. 
	
  4. UTF-8 and all your repo files to be displayed using UTF-8.
    
#
    
#import os
    
#os.environ["HGENCODING"] = "UTF-8"
    5. 



from mercurial.hgweb.hgweb_mod import hgweb

from mercurial.hgweb.hgwebdir_mod import hgwebdir

from mercurial.hgweb.request import wsgiapplication


    
	
  1. The config file looks like this.  You can have paths to individual
    2. 
	
  2. repos, collections of repos in a directory tree, or both.
    
#
    3. 
	
  3. [paths]
    4. 
	
  4. virtual/path = /real/path
    5. 
	
  5. virtual/path = /real/path
    
#
    6. 
	
  6. [collections]
    7. 
	
  7. /prefix/to/strip/off = /root/of/tree/full/of/repos
    
#
    8. 
	
  8. collections example: say directory tree /foo contains repos /foo/bar,
    9. 
	
  9. /foo/quux/baz.  Give this config section:
    10. 
	
  10. [collections]
    11. 
	
  11. /foo = /foo
    12. 
	
  12. Then repos will list as bar and quux/baz.
    
#
    13. 
	
  13. Alternatively you can pass a list of (‘virtual/path’, ‘/real/path’) tuples
    14. 
	
  14. or use a dictionary with entries like ‘virtual/path’: ‘/real/path’
    15. 



    
	
  1. application = hgwebdir(‘hgweb.config’)
    2. 
	
  2. wsgicgi.launch(application)
    3. 



def make_web_app():

return hgwebdir("/home/hg/hgweb.config")


def gateway(environ, start_response):

app = wsgiapplication(make_web_app)

return app(environ, start_response)

–∏–ª–∏ –∫–∞—á–∞–µ–º –æ—Ç—Å—é–¥–∞, –Ω–æ –≤ –Ω–µ–º –Ω–∞–¥–æ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏—é:

def make_web_app():

return hgwebdir("/export/home/hg/hgweb.config")

–∏ –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø—É—Ç—å –¥–æ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–∞ hgweb.config, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑:

[collections]

/home/hg = /home/hg

–≤ –Ω–µ–º —É–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ø—É—Ç–∏ –¥–æ –ø–∞–ø–∫–∏ –≥–¥–µ —Ö—Ä–∞–Ω—è—Ç—Å—è —Ä–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏. –î–∞–ª–µ–µ –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏–º –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—é –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è, –æ–Ω–∞ —Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ —Ñ–∞–π–ª–µ $REPO_PATH/.hg/hgrc:

[web]

contact = Anton Panasenko

description = testing Mercurial Web

style = coal

allow_read = *

allow_push = *

push_ssl = false

allow_archive = bz2 gz zip

–ø–æ–ª—è allow_read = * –∏ allow_push = * —Ä–∞–∑–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø –∫ —Ä–µ–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é. –í –Ω–∏—Ö –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —É–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –∏–º–µ–Ω–∞ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã –±—É–¥–µ—Ç–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ Apache. –î–∞–ª–µ–µ –¥–∞–µ–º –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞ Apache –Ω–∞ –ø–∞–ø–∫—É –∏ –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ–º —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç—ã –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ–º—ã–º–∏:

cd /home/

chown -R www-data:www-data hg/

chmod 755 hg/hgwebdir.py hg/modpython_gateway.py

–í –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –Ω–∞–º –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Å–∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å Apache, –∞ –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å —Ñ–∞–π–ª hg.conf:

&lt;Location /hg&gt;

PythonPath "sys.path + [ ‘/home/hg’ ]"

PythonDebug On

SetHandler mod_python

PythonHandler modpython_gateway::handler

PythonOption SCRIPT_NAME /hg

PythonOption wsgi.application hgwebdir::gateway

AuthType Basic

AuthName "Aventine Solutions"

AuthUserFile conf/httpd.passwd

&lt LimitExcept GET>

require user matthew

</LimitExcept>

</Location>

–∑–∞—Ç–µ–º –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–∏–º —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ñ–∞–π–ª –≤ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–∏–≥ Apache /etc/apache2/apache2.conf –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏–≤ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ—á–∫—É:

Include /etc/apache2/hg.conf

–∏–ª–∏ —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç—å –µ–≥–æ –≤ –ø–∞–ø–∫–µ /etc/apache2/conf.d. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω—è—è –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–∞:

/etc/init.d/apache2 restart

–∏ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤ –∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ.
